page.title: 02LAGHAM MANOR,STH.GODSTONE
page.content: { Lagham Manor}is the first recorded by name in 1169. It was then owned by Eustace of Boulogne. In 1262 the Lord of Lagham obtained a licence from the King to fortify his house with a dyke,towers and a stockade. The moat is the largest in Surrey. Soil was brought to{Lagham}to build the 30' high banks. Traces of homestead moats to keep animals safe from wolves and wild boars are easily seen. There are two drawbridges. {Lagham}suffered severely from the{ {Black Death.}The Lord and almost all the tenants died. The house fell into decay and the settlement around it disappeared. The present Jacobean house was built in 1662 on the same site as the original manorhouse and using much of the original stone. Oasthouses, and a brew house have since been added.
